headline: Air Force Contract, Arms Executive Order Spark Bullish Move For Boeing, Defense Stocks
summary: Boeing, Curtiss-Wright rise on Air Force modernization contract. President Trump reveals foreign military sales executive order.

headline: The Most Out-Of-The-World ETF Yet: Tuttle's Latest Fund Is Built Around Possible Alien Tech
summary: A new ETF, Tuttle Capital UFO Disclosure ETF (BATS: UFOD), bets on companies that could profit from government disclosure of non-human intelligence. It focuses on defense and industrial firms.

headline: Curtiss-Wright Selected by Boeing to Supply Mission Computers for U.S. Air Force C-17 Fleet Modernization
summary: DAVIDSON, N.C., February 09, 2026--Curtiss-Wright selected by Boeing to provide MOSA-aligned mission computers for U.S. Air Force C-17 Fleet Modernization. LTV $400 million.

headline: BAE Systems to provide combat-proven aircraft survivability equipment to allied nations
summary: BAE Systems (LON: BA) has received Foreign Military Sales contracts from the U.S. Army valued at $137 million to deliver its AN/AAR-57 Common Missile Warning Systems (CMWS) to allied nations. The system helps protect aircraft and crews, enhancing their survivability against missiles and other advanced threats.

headline: Should Boeing’s 737 MAX Revival and Return to Profitability Reframe the Core BA Investment Narrative?
summary: In early February 2026, Boeing and Air Cambodia announced an order for up to 20 fuel-efficient 737 MAX jets, while Boeing also reported full-year 2025 revenue of US$89.46 billion and net income of US$2.24 billion, marking a return to profitability from a prior-year loss. Alongside additional 737 MAX orders from Air India and fresh defense contracts, these developments highlight how Boeing is tying together commercial recovery and defense activity across fast-growing Asian and U.S...
